workflow.name: Extract TikTok usernames from any video or creator link format
workflow.description:
## What's the problem?

Imagine you want to **automate a task** where, based on a TikTok video link, **you must retrieve the username of the creator of that video**.

Many people may think that it's enough to get the "@" part of the link but that's not the case always. TikTok's iOS and Android app have **specific link formats** that are easier to share with others but, at the same time, it makes our task of retrieving creators way harder.

## Our solution:

**In solution to this problem, this simple workflow** makes a HTTP protocol request to retrieve the original link of the video hosted on _www.tiktok.com_ instead of the default mobile app's subdomain _vm.tiktok.com_. Then, we can in fact remove the attributes of the link and extract the handle correctly.

## Good things to know:

**Note that we extract the username** (and not the profile's nickname) **without the "@"**.

Once we have our username, we can simply access to their profile from then on using _"https://www.tiktok.com/@{{ $json.username }}"_.

nodes.name: Extract username of TikTok creator/video link
Get  final link of TikTok video

parameters.formDescription:
You can use any TikTok link format of video or creator.

E.g.:

-> https://www.tiktok.com/@dotXYZZ

-> https://www.tiktok.com/@dotXYZZ?_t=ZD-90v&_r=1

-> https://vm.tiktok.com/GDxXXXXXXX16/

-> https://www.tiktok.com/@dotXYZZ/video/436264524234?_t=YH-92meeug&_r=1

-> ...

parameters.errorMessage: An error ocurred while retrieving the creator's username!

nodes.name: Inform an error retrieving the username

parameters.completionMessage: An error ocurred while retrieving the creator's username.

=
The creator's username is: {{ $json.username }}

This means their profile link is https://www.tiktok.com/@{{ $json.username }}

parameters.content:
## Decide the input method

**If you don't want to use a form**, you can perfectly change this node to another one also called _"On form submission"_ that gets the link and assigns it to a variable called _"TikTok creator/video link:"_.

## Decide what happens when the link is invalid

**If you don't want to inform the user through the form** that the link is invalid, you can change this section.

## Decide what happens when the username retrieval fails

**If you don't want to inform the user through the form** that the an unexcpeted error ocurred while retrieving the username, you can change this section.

## Decide where to send the creator's username

**If you don't want to inform the user through the form** about the retrieved username ( _{{ $json.username }}_ ), you can send the username somewhere else.

## What does this do?

Imagine you want to **automate a task** where, based on a TikTok video link, **you must retrieve the username of the creator of that video**.

Many people may think that it's enough to get the "@" part of the link but that's not the case always. TikTok's iOS and Android app have **specific link formats** that are easier to share with others but, at the same time, it makes our task of retrieving creators way harder.

**In solution to this problem**, this simple workflow makes a HTTP protocol request to retrieve the original link of the video hosted on _www.tiktok.com_ instead of the default mobile app's subdomain _vm.tiktok.com_. Then, we can in fact remove the attributes of the link and extract the handle correctly.

**Note that we extract the username (AND NOT THE NICKNAME) without the "@".**

Once we have our username, we can simply access to their profile from then on using _"https://www.tiktok.com/@{{ $json.username }}"_.

main.node: Extract username of TikTok creator/video link
Get  final link of TikTok video
Inform an error retrieving the username
Extract username of TikTok creator/video link

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
